plugins.name: Screens Organizer
plugins.description:
How to use

A. Place all your screens inside sections, and press "Organize this page" all sections will be placed in the right order, and all other elements will be placed inside the "Misc" section


B. Add a prefix for each of your screens with "/" separation (ex. "section_name/layer_name) and press "Organize this page", all elements with the same prefix will be placed in their sections


Properties

Add color styles to sections - will add the style "figma/section" for all sections, and "figma/section_headline" for the headline if it was not created before, afterwords you able to change the style into whatever you want


Add header to sections - will add a header for each 1st level section (you're also capable to create sections inside, but not headline)


Move all components to separate page - Will move all components and variants to the "Components" page, if the page hasn't existed yet, it will also create it


Roadmap

  • Core order functionality
  • User interface
  • Headline & color styles
  • Black theme for UI
  • Index page with sections links
  • Thumbnail generator
  • Headline selection for sections
  • ...
plugins.tagline: Screens Organaizer helps you to order all your sceens inside sections in a single click

plugins.name: Cardsorting
plugins.description:
Create structures and download the result in CSV which you could open in Excel, Google Docs or Airtable.


How to use

  1. Create a list of cards (frame + name in text element) of the same color and use also the other same color for the highest category cards (also frame + name in text element).
  2. Sort cards by creating new categories and sub categories (could be every color). Put children cards in side the parent frame.
  3. Store every participant on the own page.


Example of the file: https://www.figma.com/file/oqawfzHcI4UCz1VSBD34Jb/Plugin-Card-Sorting?node-id=0%3A1

plugins.name: PlatUI - Free AI powered Figma to Code (Flutter, HTML/CSS, React Js and React Native)
plugins.description:
PlatUI AI: Revolutionize Your Development with Intelligent Design-to-Code Transformation! üöÄ

Elevate your application development by converting Figma designs into clean, responsive, production-ready code within seconds. Whether you're starting from scratch or utilizing our extensive library of design assets. PlatUI AI empowers developers and designers to create stunning web and mobile applications effortlessly.


‚ú® What is PlatUI AI?

Supports: React, Flutter, HTML/CSS, and more.


PlatUI AI is an advanced platform that leverages cutting-edge artificial intelligence to seamlessly transform your designs into clean, modular, and scalable code for both web and mobile applications. Speed up development. Automate the process.


Why Choose PlatUI AI Over Other Tools?

PlatUI AI stands out in the development landscape, offering a comprehensive suite of features that enhance productivity and streamline your workflow. Here's why PlatUI AI is the ideal choice for your next project:


üí° Getting Started with PlatUI AI

Try It Out: Click "Try It Out" on our website to begin your journey.

Run the Plugin: Launch the PlatUI AI plugin directly from your Figma file.

Select and Convert: Choose your design elements and let PlatUI AI work its magic.

Preview and Fine-Tune: Review the generated code, make adjustments, and ensure everything is perfect.

Export or Sync: Export your code or sync it directly with your development environment for seamless integration.


üåü Advanced AI Models

Our platform utilizes state-of-the-art AI models trained on millions of designs, accurately identifying and converting over 100 UI components‚Äîincluding complex elements like sliders, tables, and interactive footers. This ensures precise code generation that closely mirrors your original designs.


üõ†Ô∏è Clean Code Architecture

We prioritize scalability and maintainability by generating clean, modular code that adheres to best coding practices. This makes it easier to read, modify, and extend your codebase.


‚ö° Rapid Deployment

Download and integrate the generated code seamlessly into your favorite IDEs. With our direct integrations and extensions, you can sync your code with GitHub, and more, facilitating continuous development and deployment.


For Web Developers:

üíª Standard and Semantic Code

We generate modular, readable code by applying the DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principle and using semantic HTML tags like <header> and <footer> instead of generic <div> tags. This results in cleaner code that's easier to maintain.


üé® Flexible Styling Options

Choose from a variety of styling options, including Tailwind CSS, CSS Modules, Styled Components, and etc. Customize your CSS configurations with responsive styles, CSS variables, and your preferred units (rem or px).


üì¶ Nested Components

Design intricate UI structures by creating components within components for your React projects. This promotes reusability and modularity in your code.


üõ†Ô∏è Language and Framework Choices

Select between JavaScript or TypeScript for your web applications. Choose your preferred framework from CRA, Vite, or Webpack, tailoring your project to your specific needs.


üöÄ Instant Code Snippets

Access ready-to-use code snippets for selected UI elements, speeding up your development process and enhancing efficiency.


üåê Easy Deployment

Simplify your deployment process with direct integrations to hosting solutions like Netlify and etc, allowing you to launch your applications swiftly.


üì± Responsive UI Across Devices

Your application will look stunning on web, tablet, and mobile devices, thanks to automatic responsive design adjustments made by our platform.


For Mobile Developers:

üì± Reusable Components Library

Access a rich library of customizable UI components for faster, consistent development, reducing redundancy and enhancing maintainability.


üöÄ Efficient Asset Management

Set up and manage assets quickly, allowing you to focus on building features rather than handling boilerplate code.


üîÑ Automated Content Transfer

Seamlessly transfer content from Figma designs, eliminating manual coding errors and saving valuable time.


üîÄ Streamlined Navigation

Simplify route management in your mobile applications, enabling you to define and modify navigation flows effortlessly.


‚öôÔ∏è Personalized Configuration

Customize your app with personalized configurations, including state management libraries, to fit your technical and creative needs.


üîî User Interaction Enhancements

Implement Snackbars, Toasts, and Alert Dialogs to improve user interaction and feedback mechanisms.


üé® Benefits for Designers

Unleash your creativity with our comprehensive design assets! üéâ


Explore our impressive array of design templates or tap into our extensive screen library, featuring over 1000 screen layouts across multiple categories.


üìã Pre-built Templates

Access over 50+ ready-to-use templates designed to jump start your app projects and inspire your creativity.


üîó Share Secure Preview Links

Designers can share secure preview links of the app design, allowing stakeholders easy access without building the app or providing source code, enhancing security and convenience.


üöß Limitations

For the most accurate Figma-to-code conversion, we recommend following our standard design practices https://docs.platui.com/, complex or unconventional designs may face challenges during the conversion process.


üåê Join Our Community

Connect with like-minded professionals, share your experiences, and stay updated with the latest features by joining our vibrant community on Discord https://discord.com/invite/6z4QrsW76p.


üìû Need Assistance?

Your feedback is invaluable to us! Contact our support team at support@platui.com for any assistance or inquiries.


Experience the future of design-to-code conversion with PlatUI AI. Transform your workflow, accelerate development, and bring your ideas to life effortlessly.

plugins.name: Send to Components Page
plugins.description:
If you prefer to keep your components on a separate page and are tired of carrying them manually, this plugin is for you.


1. Select any number of Components. Frame, group, or just group selection will also work.


2. Call the plugin. All components from the selection will be transferred to a separate Components page and placed in a special Unsorted Components frame. Components will be replaced with instances.


The plugin has two independent commands to choose from:


Send to components page

(tip: For a quick search, type snc)

When this command is invoked, the Components are sent to a separate page while staying on the same page.


Send to components page and go

(tip: for a quick search, print sngo)

When this command is invoked, after moving components the focus is moved to the components page, and all newly transferred components are selected.


All components are placed in a special frame only for predictability, and you are welcome to extract the characters from the frame and organize them as you wish. See it as a predictable arrival point for new components.


Although the presence of components in the frame will not prevent further calls (i.e. you can securely call the plugin several times in a row), the plugin looks up at the contents of the frame every time, so for better performance, it makes sense to keep it as empty as possible.


A few details:


- If you already have a page named "Components" or "Symbols", the plugin will use it to place its frame. If the page doesn't exist plugin will create it and use afterward.

- If the page or frame has been deleted, the plugin will recreate the new ones at the next call

- You can rename the components page or frame as you wish.
plugins.tagline: Extract components to separate page

plugins.name: RealCover
plugins.description:
Search real covers

Effortlessly search for real media covers and app icons from iTunes, Apple Music, and the App Store by typing in keywords.


Supports a variety of covers:

  1. Music Artworks
  2. Playlists Covers
  3. Music Video Thumbnails
  4. Artist Avatars
  5. iOS App Icons
  6. macOS App Icons
  7. Podcast Covers
  8. Movie Posters
  9. Book Covers


Add Covers to Your Canvas

Simply click on an image in the search results to add it to a selected layer.


Batch Add Covers

Select multiple layers and click the "Add to Layers" button. Covers from the search results will be added to the selected layers.


Presets

Switch to the "Preset" tab, where you'll find some preset keywords. Click on these keywords to directly add covers to your selected layers.


Settings

Change the search region and image resolution in the "Settings" tab.


Helps

If you're experiencing any issues or have questions about RealCover please contact me at GetRealCover@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Find and add covers for music artworks, app icons, and movie posters directly within Figma.

121473.name: RealCover
121473.description:
Search real covers

Effortlessly search for real media covers and app icons from iTunes, Apple Music, and the App Store by typing in keywords.


Supports a variety of covers:

  1. Music Artworks
  2. Playlists Covers
  3. Music Video Thumbnails
  4. Artist Avatars
  5. iOS App Icons
  6. macOS App Icons
  7. Podcast Covers
  8. Movie Posters
  9. Book Covers


Add Covers to Your Canvas

Simply click on an image in the search results to add it to a selected layer.


Batch Add Covers

Select multiple layers and click the "Add to Layers" button. Covers from the search results will be added to the selected layers.


Presets

Switch to the "Preset" tab, where you'll find some preset keywords. Click on these keywords to directly add covers to your selected layers.


Settings

Change the search region and image resolution in the "Settings" tab.


Helps

If you're experiencing any issues or have questions about RealCover please contact me at GetRealCover@gmail.com


Thanks

RealCover is inspired by iTunes Artwork Finder by Ben Dodson and Any App Finder by Sylvester Lau

networkAccess.reasoning: To utilize this plugin, access to both the iTunes API, Apple Music API, and Amazon Product API is necessary for retrieving search results. Additionally, each time the plugin accesses Apple Music API, it requires a JSON Web Token generated by the realcover-jwtserver.vercel.app service.

121473.release_notes: RealCover now remembers your last search type, so you no longer need to switch back and forth.
121473.tagline: Find and add covers for music artworks, app icons, and movie posters directly within Figma.

plugins.name: Reset Layer Name
plugins.description:
Reset names of selected layers to default.

You can reset names of EVERY element!

Text, frames, groups, rectangles, instance, etc.


üî• How to use

  1. Select one or more layers.
  2. Run this plugin.
  3. Enjoyü§ü


‚úèÔ∏è Note: Behavior

This plugin behaves differently depending on the type of element selected.


(Component or variants)

This plugin will not rename and keep the original name of the component or variants.


(Instance)

This plugin renames the element to the name of the main component.


(Child element of instance)

This plugin renames element to the name of the same child element of the main component.

Note: Due to limitations of the plugin API, it is not resetting the override. It just renames to the same name.


(Other types of elements)

This plugin renames the element to empty. That is, it resets it.


üìÆ Support

If you have any plobrem or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.


===

plugins.name: Component Tracker
plugins.description:
Component Tracker - a plugin that helps you organize and track components in your projects, whether they're sourced from libraries or created locally. Gain better control and visibility over your designs by seeing exactly how and where components are being used, improving both consistency and efficiency in your workflow.


  1. Automatic Component Listing: The plugin dynamically generates a list of all components used in your project, distinguishing between those from libraries and those created locally.
  2. Usage Counter: Keep tabs on the number of times each component is used within your document, helping you identify popular or underutilized elements in your designs.
  3. Organized Frame Overview: The plugin neatly displays all relevant information in a dedicated frame, allowing you to get an at-a-glance overview of your component usage.


Component Tracker helps you organizing and maintaining design consistency across your documents.


Special thanks to @elsasavenay for the UI ! ;)

The Fake Data Generator plugin is a powerful tool designed to streamline the process of populating your designs with realistic placeholder content. With just a few clicks, this plugin generates a variety of mock data, including names, addresses, emails, phone numbers, and more.


Whether you're designing a website, app, or presentation, this plugin saves you valuable time by instantly providing the content you need to bring your designs to life. Say goodbye to manual data entry and hello to efficient, realistic content generation.


Data provided by website.

plugins.name: Used text styles
plugins.description:
üá¨üáß Plugin for inspecting used text styles.


How to use

  1. Run the plugin
  2. Select node with text (frame, component or group)
  3. Manage your styles: if text node has linked style, plugin shows style's name, else plugin shows font name
  4. By clicking the style you can scroll to the element to bind or unbind style or change font properties


NOTE: in browser when you change styles via editor panel and plugin is running font selection may crush. So just remove selection from node, chage font and select back.


It supports mixed text styles like 'sample text', when you use different text settings for some words. But, please, use different text blocks for different styles, because it's easier for developer to inspect your designs.


It doesn't support multiple node selection so as not to overload Figma.

plugins.name: vga displace.exe
plugins.description:
Sculpting visual dreams.


Transform your images using the power of displacement maps. Whether you want to create surreal effects, simulate textures, or distort visuals in a controlled manner, this plugin empowers you to do so with precision. This process opens the door to a realm of creative possibilities, enabling you to apply a myriad of imaginative warping effects.


Features:

‚Äî Import any objects, images, groups & frames.

‚Äî Fine-tune the effect's scale, blur, and quality on separate axes.

‚Äî Real time preview (via GPU).


Note:

‚Äî Works with BW and Colors displacement maps.

‚Äî Export to 4096 pixels by default.


[Link] to sample file



_

VGA

Video.Graphic.Array [Collection] #8

plugins.name: 42 comments
plugins.description:
A plugin that allows you to see and search comments while staying in design mode with comments organised by pages and frames.


Key features


  • Search in Comments
  • Comments organised by Pages and Frames
  • Comments remain usable in design mode; click one, and we highlight it on a page
  • Use #tags in your comments for better navigation


How to use


When you run the plugin, it offers a simple 2 step onboarding screen explaining how things work.


  • During the first run, we'll ask you to create a Personal Token so that we can fetch comments via API. Your token is only stored on your machine inside the Figma app, and we won't ask for it again.
  • Since public plugins don't have access to File Keys, we also ask for the File Key during the first plugin run on a new file.
  • All subsequent plugin runs get you directly to your comments!


Roadmap


  • Prioritising comments
  • Fuzzy search
  • Comments search via suggestion results


Sidenote


This is our first-ever plugin on Figma, and while things might not be ideal all at once, we are happy to hear your feedback, questions, and suggestions at hello@happypanini.dev


Data Security & Network access


Our plugin does not have any remote counterpart, it means you data is only stored on your computer, inside your Figma editor. This applies to all of your data, tokens and comments.


Network access is used to retrieve comments from Figma API, as well as fetching avatars of the people commenting.


About

  • Design & Idea by Yuliya Savyuk
  • Implementation in code by Oleksandr Shchapov
  • Illustrations Pebble People by Deivid Saenz
plugins.tagline: Navigate comments while designing. Tiny useful thing that is still missing!

1. Select a text object

plugins.name: Atlas ‚Äì Theme Manager
plugins.description:
Atlas is an easy-to-use theme manager that works alongside the styling system.


See examples at jwels.berlin/atlas

Watch a short tutorial clip on youtube.com


How it works

Styles can be put into folders in Figma. These folders are equivalent to writing forward slashes in your files. Atlas uses this convention and adds theming capabilities to it. So you can have a 'Light', 'Dark' or any other folder for your color, effect, and text styles and then switch between them.


Have questions or feedback? Reach out on twitter.com/JulianWels

accepted.description: Code, Comic and Design Human from Berlin // he+him

plugins.description:
Revolutionize your design process with Map Builder for Figma. This powerful plugin allows you to seamlessly integrate maps within your design projects, offering a range of features that cater to both functionality and aesthetics. Enhance your projects with detailed maps that align perfectly with your design vision.


Features:


  1. Layer Selection: Effortlessly select specific layers within your Figma file to start building and integrating your maps.
  2. Map Integration: Integrate various map types directly into your designs, including roadmaps, satellite views, and terrain maps. Choose between Google Maps and Mapbox for a versatile mapping experience.
  3. Google Maps and Mapbox Functions: Create and visualize routes between multiple points, ideal for travel planning and logistics visualization.
  4. Free Usage and Upgrade Option: Enjoy a limited number of free map creations, with the option to upgrade to unlimited usage for a nominal fee.
  5. License Management: Enter your license code to unlock unlimited map-building capabilities and access premium support.
  6. User Notifications: Stay informed with notifications about your usage limits and easily upgrade to continue using the plugin without interruptions.
  7. Customer Support: Reach out to our dedicated support team for any assistance, ensuring a smooth and productive experience with the plugin.


Why Choose Map Builder?


Map Builder is designed to provide designers with a comprehensive tool for integrating maps within Figma. Whether you‚Äôre working on travel guides, logistical plans, or location-based projects, Map Builder offers the flexibility and functionality needed to create stunning maps.


Get Started Today!

plugins.name: Chart BG
plugins.description:
‚úèÔ∏è Please, drop your suggestions in the comments! It'll help make the plugin even better and more useful.



Description:

"Chart BG is a Figma plugin that automatically adds a gradient background to the selected vector object. The plugin creates a new layer with a gradient fill underneath the selected object, making your graphic elements more visually appealing.


How to use:

1. Select a vector object:

  1. Make sure you have a single vector object with a stroke selected on your current Figma page.

2. Run the plugin:

  1. Go to the "Plugins" menu in Figma.
  2. Find and run "Chart BG".

3. Enjoy the result:

  1. The plugin will automatically create a gradient background beneath your vector object.
  2. You will receive a notification upon completion.


Notes:

  1. The plugin only works with vector objects.
  2. If more than one object is selected or the object is not a vector, the plugin will notify you of the error.
  3. The plugin inherits the vector color to create a gradient.


Create stylish graphic elements quickly and easily with "Chart BG‚Äù!


Made by Sergei Goltsov
plugins.tagline: Create a new layer with a gradient fill underneath the selected object

plugins.name: Annotation Helper
plugins.description:
Enhance Your Figma Design Collaboration with Annotation Helper: A Must-Have for Efficient Teamwork


Annotation Helper, specifically designed for Figma, revolutionizes design collaboration by introducing an intuitive and efficient annotation system. It's the perfect tool for teams looking to enhance their workflow in Figma. Key features include:


  • Streamlined Annotations: Create annotations directly on Figma design files, improving communication and clarity in your design projects.
  • Badge and Card System: Every annotation is accompanied by a visual badge and a descriptive card, ensuring that feedback is not only visible but also detailed and informative.
  • Comprehensive Description Cards: Each card includes essential elements like a title, description, status symbol, and color coding, making it easier to understand and follow up on feedback.
  • Coherent Linking of Badges and Cards: This feature maintains consistency between visual indicators and detailed information, crucial for effective design collaboration in Figma.
  • Hideable Badges for a Clean Interface: Optimize your design space by hiding badges when they are not needed, ensuring a clutter-free interface.
  • Lockable Annotations for Secure Feedback: Lock annotations to prevent accidental edits, preserving the integrity and intention of the feedback.
  • Grouped Annotations for Organized Feedback: Color-coded grouping helps in organizing annotations, making it easier to navigate through feedback.
  • Customizable Group and Annotation Ordering: Prioritize and arrange feedback efficiently, streamlining the design review process.
  • Page-Specific Annotation Collections: Each Figma page hosts its collection of annotations, enhancing organization and accessibility.
  • Efficient Annotation Search Functionality: Quickly find specific annotations, saving time and improving the efficiency of your design collaboration in Figma.


Annotation Helper is an indispensable plugin for designers, teams, and anyone seeking an integrated, efficient approach to feedback and collaboration in Figma. It's a game-changer in the realm of design collaboration, promising to elevate your design process to new heights of efficiency and clarity.
plugins.tagline: Create annotations with ease for effective collaboration and communication in design.

plugins.name: Figma to Handoff
plugins.description:
With the Figma to Handoff, you can quickly convert your designs to HTML, CSS and Vue code.


It allows you to copy-paste Auto Layout enabled layers to Handoff. From the Handoff interface, you can export the code as a .zip file or copy-paste the code right into your IDE.


How it works

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Sign up for a free Handoff account
  3. In Figma, right-click ‚Üí plugins ‚Üí Figma to code with Handoff
  4. Select a layer
  5. Click 'Export layers'
  6. In Handoff, right-click ‚Üí Paste from Figma


Tip: To make full use of this plugin and to ensure good code quality, please read the Handoff documentation article 'Importing from Figma'.

plugins.name: Color Sync
plugins.description:
Maintain inheritance between color styles. Create parent-child relationships between color styles by using the description field of the color style.Configuration is quick and easy:


  1. Add the name of the parent into the description of a child style.
  2. Run the plugin! All children will inherit their parent‚Äôs color. If there is a change to a parent style, all the child styles will update.


You can use modifiers to manipulate inherited colors, by simply including the modifier into the description of the child style:


  • lightness=x%: Set a fixed lightness between the values of 0 and 100
plugins.tagline: Color inheritance made easy!

plugins.name: Titleitos glow
plugins.description:
Titleitos: glow (Large)


Create titles and comments with a click of a button.

It's that simple.


Use a keyboard shortcut, or select Titleitos from your plugins menu (or just type it on cmd bar CMD+/) and that's it! you made a titleito!


If you select an Object / Frame and use the Titleitos plugin, the title will appear above on the y axis. If not, it will just float on your screen for fast use.


How to add a keyboard shortcut (Mac)?

  1. Go to System Preferences
  2. Search for Keyboard
  3. Click on Shortcuts tab
  4. Search for "App Shortcuts"
  5. Add Figma.app
  6. Click on the + and Type in: "Titleitos glow"
  7. Chose your shortcut by typing for example: CMD+Option+Shift+,
  8. That's it!


Enjoy!


(I made this plugin for my own use, but why not to share it?)
plugins.tagline: Add title above anything

plugins.name: Export Settings Helper
plugins.description:
Automatic applies export settings for iOS/Android/web assets in your design. Developers don't need to install additional plugins for correct slice formats. Also, it comes with small useful tools to make your handoff work more efficient.


The plugin can

  • Apply exports for iOS/Android/web to selection
  • Clear all existed exports
  • Select object with export settings or visible slices
  • Rename layer names to snake_case, kebab-case, or lower case to fit development requirements


How to use

  1. Select the objects need to export
  2. Press Cmd+/ to search "Export Settings Apply for iOS" (Android, or web) and press enter
  3. Done. Handoff.
